result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen G Zabel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *May terminate after 6 months if deemed appropriate by Agent.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Anger Management and/or Domestic Violence Counseling if deemed appropriate by Agent.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Stephen G Zabel in court with Attorney Sarah A Ponath.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Shannon Tenney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Attorney Ponath requests a sentencing date.  Court adjourns for sentencing.    Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stephen G Zabel in court with Attorney Sarah A Ponath.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ponath requests an adjournment.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on April 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Attorney Ponath has been appointed. Defendant to pay: $25/month commencing April 1, 2016.
Hearing on April 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Stephen G Zabel in court.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant did not qualify for public defender representation.  Defendant requests court appointed counsel.  Court reviews petition and grants Defendant's request for a court appointed attorney.  Defendant to pau for such counsel at rate of $25.00 per month, commencing 4/1/16 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full.  Court sets review date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Hearing at 03-07-2016 09:30 am

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Stephen G Zabel in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
